title: Genetic Foundations of Pharmacogenomics: Exploring Core Principles Through Flipped Learning

context.prior_knowledge: Fundamental genetics concepts (genes, chromosomes, inheritance laws) and basic understanding of drug mechanism of action
context.additional_context: Targets pre-professionals in medical/technical fields. Emphasizes personalized digital device utilization and discussion-based collaborative learning

learning_goals: Learners can explain the principles of predicting individual differences in drug responses through genetic cross analysis.
Learners can evaluate the correlation between genetic traits and drug efficacy by applying pedigree analysis.
Learners can achieve a 20% or greater improvement in assessment scores after flipped learning activities.
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
